The Teachings of Don Quant A Quantitative Way of Knowledge

About

Hi, my name is Evgeny Laba and I’m the man behind this site. I hold Master’s degree in Economics and have a banking background.

About Blog

This is my personal blog deticated mostly to quantitative finance, data science and related subjects. I’m amused with it because it spans a lot of great disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, artificial intelligence etc. and also combines theoretic knowledge with engineering/programming skills. Substantially this blog is my playground with math, code and data applied to an area of aforementioned interests. I share it online with anybody who might find it interesting or useful in any kind.

About Blog Name

The name of this blog originated as a little wordplay and modification of Carlos Castaneda’s first book title “The Teachings of Don Juan: A Yaqui Way of Knowledge”. Castaneda’s story is quite controversial one. As I read the book during my youth I viewed it (as many others) as a fictional acid trip mixed with magic and philosophy. Needless to say I still hold this view, despite and to my susprise, I found later that this book was actually Castaneda’s Master’s thesis in anthropology at UCLA in 1968! He also received his Ph.D. based on a material from two books that followed and which are a continuation of the original story. Scientific grounds of his works are highly questionable and it is a subject of heavy scepticism. So when the time came to give some meaningful and unique name to this blog, besides that Juan kinda rhymes with quant (not really), I decided to use this title because contrary to subjective studies quantitative disciplines are based on highly precise mathematical language and supported by factual information of data. This makes quantitative researh reproducible. Hence the name “The Teaching of Don Quant: A Quantitative Way of Knowledge” as this blog’s mostly about quant stuff.
